results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about Greta Garbo's 1935 film "Anna Karenina" and the details you mentioned:

## Box Office Performance
The film earned $2,304,000 at the box office, which aligns very closely with the $2.3 million figure you referenced in your search query.

## New York Film Critics Circle Award
Greta Garbo received a New York Film Critics Circle Award for Best Actress for her role as Anna in the 1935 version. This was one of two such awards she received from the New York Film Critics Circle - Garbo twice received the New York Film Critics Circle Award for Best Actress: for Anna Karenina in 1935, and for Camille in 1936.

## Film Details
The 1935 "Anna Karenina" was a Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer film adaptation of the 1877 novel Anna Karenina by Leo Tolstoy and directed by Clarence Brown. The film stars Greta Garbo, Fredric March, Basil Rathbone, and Maureen O'Sullivan.

## Additional Recognition
Beyond the box office success and the New York Film Critics Circle Award, the film won the Mussolini Cup for best foreign film at the Venice Film Festival. The film itself was named one of the top ten films of 1935 by the National Board of Review, USA.

## Critical Reception
The film was both a financial and critical success. Directed by Garbo's favourite director, Clarence Brown, with cinematography by William Daniels, Garbo's favourite photographer, "Anna Karenina" emerged a financial and critical success.

This was Garbo's second portrayal of Anna Karenina - Garbo also was the lead in the 1927 version of Anna Karenina, released under the title Love.
